org.vaniglia.messagequeue
Class MessageQueue

java.lang.Object
  org.vaniglia.messagequeue.MessageQueue
public class MessageQueue
extends java.lang.Object

The MessageQueue is a queue of messages that are stored using a MessageStorega and are ordered by a timestamp. The messages in the queue are processed by all the MessageListener subscribed to the queue and than removed. Messages are processed only after their due date. The due date of a message is set to the message by calling the push method of the MessageQueue.

Constructor Detail

MessageQueue

private MessageQueue(java.lang.String name,
                     MessageStorageType storageType,
                     MessageStorageParameters params)
Private constructor. To create a Message queue, the static method, getQueue must be used.

Parameters:
name - the name of the Message Queue.
storageType - the Storage Type to use for the Message Queue.
params - the parameters for the storage.
Method Detail

getQueue

public static MessageQueue getQueue(java.lang.String name,
                                    MessageStorageType storageType,
                                    MessageStorageParameters params)
                             throws MessageQueueException
This method is used to get a MessageQueue and set (at the same time) its underlaying storage system. This method will raise and exception if the MessageQueue as been already created because in that case the underlaying storage systema can't be changed.

Parameters:
name - the queue name
storageType - the storage type for the queue
params - the parameter for the storage
Returns:
the Message Queue
Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the Queue has been already created and the storage type is different from the one used on the queue creation.

getQueue

public static MessageQueue getQueue(java.lang.String name)
This method returns a Message Queue given its name. The Queue will be created using the default storage type if has not been created yet.

Parameters:
name - the Message Queue's name
Returns:
the Message Queue with the given name

deleteQueue

public static void deleteQueue(java.lang.String name)
This method wipes out a Message Queue from the system. The Message Storage used by the Queue will also be deleted.

Parameters:
name - the name of the Message Queue to delete

removeAllQueues

public static void removeAllQueues()
This method cleans up the system from all the existing Message Queues.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the Queue name

Returns:
the queue name

getProcessingInterval

public int getProcessingInterval()
This method returns the queue processing interval (milliseconds).

Returns:
the queue processing interval (milliseconds)

setProcessingInterval

public void setProcessingInterval(int millis)
                           throws MessageQueueException
This method sets the queue processing interval (milliseconds). The processing interval is the time elapse between processings of messages in the queue. The default value is 1 second (1000 milliseconds).

Parameters:
millis - the queue processing interval.
Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the queue has already been started.

start

public void start()
           throws MessageQueueException
Starts the queue processing task.

Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the queue is already running.

start

public void start(long interval)
           throws MessageQueueException
Starts the queue processing task using the provided processing interval instead of the queue own interval.

Parameters:
interval - the processing interval.
Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the queue is already running

stop

public void stop()
          throws MessageQueueException
Stops the queue

Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the queue is not running

publish

public void publish(Message msg)
             throws MessageStorageException
Publish a message to the queue using the current time.

Parameters:
msg - the message to publish
Throws:
MessageStorageException - in case something goes wrong with the underlaying storage system.

publish

public void publish(Message msg,
                    long timestamp)
             throws MessageStorageException
Publish a message to the queue.

Parameters:
msg - the message to publish
timestamp - the message due time.
Throws:
MessageStorageException - in case something goes wrong with the underlaying storage system.

subscribe

public void subscribe(MessageListener listener)
               throws MessageQueueException
Subscribe a listener to the queue.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to subscribe
Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the listener is already subscribed

unsubscribe

public void unsubscribe(MessageListener listener)
                 throws MessageQueueException
Unsubscribes a listener from the queue

Parameters:
listener - the listener to unsubscribe
Throws:
MessageQueueException - if the listener is not subscribed

clear

public void clear()
Clears the queue. All messages in the queue will be lost.

handle

void handle()
This is the method called by the Queue Processing Task.

public MessageStorageType getStorageType()
Returns the storage type used by the queue.

Returns:
the queue storage type.

size

public long size()
Returns the number of messages in the queue. This number does include also messages currently in handling.

Returns:
the number of messags in the queue.

getMessageList

public java.lang.String[] getMessageList()
Returns a list of all messages in the queue. The list includes also messages currently in handling.

Returns:
a list of all the message's ids in the queue.

getAllMessages

public Message[] getAllMessages()
Returns all messages in the queue.
